DataElement.preferredName: Health Care Provider Training Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to signify whether the health care providers are trained

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Health Care Provider Training Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care._To teach with hands-on experience_Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities, or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.

Concepts.definition: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.

Property.preferredDefinition: To teach with hands-on experience:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ReferenceDocuments.name: At least two health care prov
ReferenceDocuments.description: At least two health care providers who completed the AH-HA provider training (e.g., physicians, nurse practitioners, physician assistants; at least one should have used the tool with enrolled patients) AND  Two members of the site administrative team who participated in the implementation of AH-HA. This will include clinic administrators and/or information technology specialists and is likely to include:  facility program directors and other staff (e.g., technology support). Coordinators of centralized services for EHR maintenance at the practice would also be eligible.

ReferenceDocuments.name: W-1804CD
ReferenceDocuments.description: Health care provider who completed the AH-HA provider training (e.g., physicians, nurse practitioners, physician assistants) AND Two members of the site administrative team who participated in the implementation of AH-HA. This will include clinic administrators and/or information technology specialists and is likely to include: facility program directors and other staff (e.g., technology support). Coordinators of centralized services for EHR maintenance at the practice would also be eligible.

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF1805CD
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is willing to complete study-specific trainings and incorporate HN-STAR or provide usual care in a routine follow-up care visit.

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF1805CDv2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Willing to complete study-specific trainings and incorporate HN-STAR or provide usual care in a routine follow-up care visit.

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF 1804CD
ReferenceDocuments.description: Two members of the site administrative team who participated in the implementation of the AH-HA tool. This will include clinic administrators and/or information technology specialists and is likely to include: facility program directors and other staff (e.g., technology support). Coordinators of centralized services for EHR maintenance at the practice would also be eligible.
